comments:
Build: I20050215-2300

If I try to run a SWT application on Motif using the "Run As->SWT Application",
I get the following excpetion. This happens because the "java.library.path" is
set to ".../workspace/org.eclipse.swt.gtk//os/linux/x86", which is the GTK
fragment instead of the Motif one.

Note also that there are double slashes.

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: no swt-motif-3123 in
java.library.path
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadLibrary(ClassLoader.java:1491)
	at java.lang.Runtime.loadLibrary0(Runtime.java:788)
	at java.lang.System.loadLibrary(System.java:834)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.Library.loadLibrary(Library.java:123)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.motif.OS.<clinit>(OS.java:18)
	at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Device.<clinit>(Device.java:107)
	at org.eclipse.swt.examples.graphics.ClippingImage.main(ClippingImage.java:10)

what is your environment as specified on the PDE > Target Platform > Target 
Environment preference?

os -> linux
ws -> motif
arch -> x86
nl -> en_US

A case like this one is tough because we have more than one legitimate 
fragment.  The workspace can contain multiple fragments for all platforms, and 
the installation may contain multiple fragments if the user has installed the 
rcp delta pick.  so which one do we choose?

We will be able to answer this question easily soon when swt starts declaring 
a platform filter in its manifest.mf.

But until then, here is what I will do:

if I get a single matching fragment, then simply use it.
if there is more than one matching fragment, then use the one whose id 
is "org.eclipse.swt.$WS$, where $WS$ is the ws value as specified on the PDE > 
target platform > target environment preference page.

Here is where it gets somewhat messier:
in the case where the ws is 'gtk' and we have two gtk fragments (regular and 
64), we check the arch value to break the tie.

This is all transient until the manifest.mf gets updated.
